com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCExtendedTableBindingData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCExtendedTableBindingData

  • public class YRCExtendedTableBindingData
extends java.lang.Object
    The binding data class for extended tables. This class provides various resource providers for the table columns to display the data.

      Set the cell modifier that should handle the cell editors for the editable columns of the extended table.
      void setCellTypes(java.util.HashMap cellTypes)
      The method is used to define the cell editor for the editable table columns (added through extensibility) in the table.
      void setColorProvider(YRCExtendedTableColorProvider colorProvider)
      Set the color provider for the extended table if the table columns added through extensibility needs to be painted with colors based on the values of the table cell or the column type.
      void setImageProvider(YRCExtendedTableImageProvider imageProvider)
      The image provider should be set for the extended column if there is need for displaying images on the table column based on some logical operation.

      Sets the link provider for the extended table.

      • getLinkProvider

        public final YRCExtendedTableLinkProvider getLinkProvider()
        Returns:
        The link provider for the extended columns in the table.
        See Also:
        setLinkProvider(YRCExtendedTableLinkProvider)

      • setLinkProvider

        public final void setLinkProvider(YRCExtendedTableLinkProvider linkProvider)
        Sets the link provider for the extended table. If a link provider is set for the table, the table columns added through extensibility may have links. 
                YRCExtendedTableLinkProvider linkProvider = new YRCExtendedTableLinkProvider() {
                public void linkSelected(Object element, String property) {
                        // Perform the action when the link is clicked.
                        YRCPlatformUI.showInformation("LinkClicked", "Link clicked through extensibility. Current property is: " + property);
                }
                public String getLinkTheme(Object element, String property) {
                        // Return the theme for the link. The theme's font and
                        // foreground color is used to display the link.
                        return "TableLink";
                }
        });
        Parameters:
        linkProvider - The link provider for the extended table columns.
        See Also:
        YRCExtendedTableLinkProvider

      • setColorProvider

        public final void setColorProvider(YRCExtendedTableColorProvider colorProvider)
        Set the color provider for the extended table if the table columns added through extensibility needs to be painted with colors based on the values of the table cell or the column type.
        Parameters:

      • getCellModifier

        public final YRCExtendedCellModifier getCellModifier()

      • setCellModifier

        public final void setCellModifier(YRCExtendedCellModifier cellModifier)
        Set the cell modifier that should handle the cell editors for the editable columns of the extended table.
        Following snippet shows how to create and set a cell modifier to the extended table binding data. 
         YRCExtendedCellModifier sampleTableCellModifier = new YRCExtendedCellModifier() {
        public boolean allowModify(String property, String value, Element element) {
                // Return the value indicating if the cell is ready to be modified.
                // If the cell should not be modified for some reason, return false.
                return true;
        }
        
        public YRCValidationResponse validateModifiedValue(String property, String value, Element element) {
                //Return an instance of YRCValidationResponse with an appropriate status code and status message
            return new YRCValidationResponse(YRCValidationResponse.YRC_VALIDATION_OK,"Status message");
        }
        
        public String getModifiedValue(String property, String value, Element element) {
                // Return the value if it needs to be modified after some further processing.
                // If no further processing is required, return the value itself.
                return value;
        }
        
 };
 
 sampleTableBindingData.setCellModifier(sampleTableCellModifier);
        Parameters:
        cellModifier - The cell modifier to handle the cell editors in the table columns.
        See Also:
        YRCExtendedCellModifier, YRCValidationResponse

      • getTableColumnBindingDatas

        public java.util.HashMap getTableColumnBindingDatas()
        Returns:
        A HashMap of table column binding data. The table column name is the key and corresponding value is the binding data for the column.

      • setTableColumnBindingsMap

        public void setTableColumnBindingsMap(java.util.HashMap tableColumnBindingsMap)
        Method to set the binding data for the advanced table columns added to the table through extensibility.
        Here is a sample snippet where we create and return the map of column bindinga datas. 
                private HashMap getTblClmBindingDatas() {
        
        // Create a map of binding datas. This map contains the column
        // name as the key and the corresponding binding data as the value.
        HashMap bindingDataMap = new HashMap();
        
        // extn_AdvClm: Adavnced Column 1 added through extensibility.
        // Create a new binding data for the first extended column.
        // This is an editable cell as defined by the 
        // setCellTypes(HashMap).
        YRCTblClmBindingData clmBindingData = new YRCTblClmBindingData();        
        clmBindingData.setAttributeBinding("@Quantity");
        // Add the binding data to the data map.
        bindingDataMap.put("extn_AdvClm", clmBindingData);
        
        // extn_AdvClm2: Advanced Column 2 added through extensibility.
        // This is an example of a column with link. To display a column with a 
        // link.
        clmBindingData = new YRCTblClmBindingData();
        clmBindingData.setAttributeBinding("@ItemID");
        // Set link required to true so that this column is ready to display 
        // link on its cells. This is merely a definition that say that the
        // column is ready to display the link. To handle the display of the 
        // link and the link selection event one must set the extended link
        // provider setLinkProvider(YRCExtendedTableLinkProvider) to 
        // the table binding data.
        clmBindingData.setLinkReqd(true);
        bindingDataMap.put("extn_AdvClm2", clmBindingData);
        
        // extn_AdvClm3: Advanced Column 3 added through extensibility.
        // This is an example of a dynamic combo box used as the cell
        // editor. For creating a combo box cell editor create the binding 
        // object for the dynamic combo and set a content provider to it.
        clmBindingData = new YRCTblClmBindingData();
        clmBindingData.setAttributeBinding("ProductClass");
        clmBindingData.setColumnBinding("Product_Class");
        clmBindingData.setSortReqd(true);
        // Create and set the binding data for the combo box cell editor.
        YRCDynamicComboBindingData comboData = new YRCDynamicComboBindingData();
        comboData.setKey("Combo");
        comboData.setDescriptionBinding("CommonCode;CodeShortDescription");
        comboData.setListBinding("CommonCodeList:CommonCodeList/CommonCode");
        comboData.setCodeBinding("CommonCode");
        comboData.setComboContentProvider(new IYRCComboContentProvider(){
                public Element getModel(Element element, String property) {
                        Element model = null;
                        String newAttr = element.getAttribute("OrderNo");
                        // Get the xml model that needs to be used to populate the combo box.
                        // Create a new copy. perform the required changes and return it.
                        // This model is used to populate the cell editor and display the
                        // text in the table cell. 
                        model = YRCXmlUtils.getCopy(getExtentionModel("extn_CommonCodeList"));
                        Element child = YRCXmlUtils.createChild(model, "CommonCode");
                        child.setAttribute("CommonCode", "D");
                        child.setAttribute("CodeShortDescription", "Current OrderNo: " + newAttr);
                        return model;
                }
        });
        clmBindingData.setBindingData(comboData); // Set the binding data for the dynamic combo box cell editor.
        bindingDataMap.put("extn_AdvClm3", clmBindingData);
 
        // Retunr the binding data map for the advanced columns.
        return bindingDataMap;
        }
        Parameters:
        tableColumnBindingsMap - A HashMap of table column binding data for the advanced extended table columns. The column name should be the key and the corresponding binding data should be passed as the value.
        See Also:
        setCellModifier(YRCExtendedCellModifier), setCellTypes(HashMap), setLinkProvider(YRCExtendedTableLinkProvider), setCellTypes(HashMap), setImageProvider(YRCExtendedTableImageProvider)

      • getCellTypes

        public java.util.HashMap getCellTypes()
        Returns:
        A HashMap of field name versus editor types. If the HashMap doesnt contain an editor type definition for a given table column name no cell editor will be opened for that cell.

      • setCellTypes

        public void setCellTypes(java.util.HashMap cellTypes)
        The method is used to define the cell editor for the editable table columns (added through extensibility) in the table. For a table column to be editable pass the column name as the key and the cell type for the of the columns as the corresponding value in the HashMap. To set the cell type to the extended table binding data, first create the cell types map and set it to the table binding data.
        Following snippet shows one of the ways to create and set the cell types map. 
         // Get and set the cell type def to the extended table binding data.
 extendedTableBindingData.setCellTypes(getCellTypes());
        The following snippet shows how to define the cell types for the advanced columns. 
         public HashMap getCellTypes() {
        HashMap cellTypesMap = new HashMap();
        cellTypesMap .put("extn_AdvClm", YRCConstants.YRC_TEXT_BOX_CELL_EDITOR);
        cellTypesMap.put("extn_AdvClm3", YRCConstants.YRC_COMBO_BOX_CELL_EDITOR);
        return cellTypesMap;
 }
        NOTE: This is a definition for the cell types. If the cell type is not defined for a column, then that column will not be editbale. Moreover, in order to edit the cell and have a handle to the editing events, one must set the setCellModifier(YRCExtendedCellModifier) in the extended table bindng data.
        Parameters:
        cellTypes - The HashMap containing the definition of table columns' cell types. If the cell type for a table column is not defined then it means that the table column will not be an editable column.
        See Also:
        YRCConstants.YRC_COMBO_BOX_CELL_EDITOR, YRCConstants.YRC_CHECK_BOX_CELL_EDITOR, YRCConstants.YRC_TEXT_BOX_CELL_EDITOR, setCellModifier(YRCExtendedCellModifier)

      • getTooltipTextProvider

        public YRCExtendedTableTooltipTextProvider getTooltipTextProvider()
        Returns:
        See Also:
        setTooltipTextProvider(YRCExtendedTableTooltipTextProvider)

        Parameters:
        tooltipTextProvider - The tooltip text provider for the extended table columns.
